content:
Portillo's is a Chicago institution! Their hot dogs and Italian beef sandwiches are legendary. Glad you got to try it during your layover!

Moto is a great choice for Italian food, too! They're known for their creative, farm-to-table take on Italian cuisine. Nashville has a fantastic food scene, doesn't it?

Now, about coffee shops near Millennium Park... You're in luck! There are several excellent options within walking distance:

1. **Intelligentsia Coffee**: A Chicago-based coffee roaster with a café location near Millennium Park. They're known for their expertly crafted pour-overs and espresso drinks. (About a 5-minute walk from Millennium Park)
2. **La Colombe Coffee Roasters**: This popular coffee chain has a location near Millennium Park, offering a variety of specialty drinks and a cozy atmosphere. (About a 5-minute walk from Millennium Park)
3. **Starbucks Reserve Bar**: If you're a Starbucks fan, this Reserve Bar location is a unique spot that offers a more upscale coffee experience, including specialty drinks and a coffee tasting menu. (About a 10-minute walk from Millennium Park)
4. **The Coffee Studio**: A locally owned coffee shop with a cozy atmosphere and a focus on small-batch, artisanal coffee. They also serve pastries and light bites. (About a 10-minute walk from Millennium Park)
5. **Brewpoint Coffee**: Another local favorite with a location near Millennium Park. They offer a variety of specialty drinks, including nitro coffee and tea, as well as delicious pastries and sandwiches. (About a 10-minute walk from Millennium Park)

These coffee shops are all within walking distance of Millennium Park, so you can grab a cup of coffee and enjoy the scenery before or after your visit to the park.

Enjoy your coffee and your time in Chicago!
